1.16.text: So now, can we please move on.

11.72.text: It had a 2.4 litre Ferrari V6, mounted in the middle

16.62.text: It was Italian. It was styled by Bertone...

24.36.text: It therefore ticked all the super-car boxes

28.66.text: but unlike any other super-car before or since, it wasn't designed to be parked in Monte Carlo...

36.32.text: It was designed to get there - like this.

41.70.text:
it's absurdly short wheelbase meant it
was agile

45.38.text: and the Ferrari power meant it was fast...

48.32.text: ...so fast that it won the World Rally Championship three times

54.80.text: and joy of joys, they made 500 Stratos's for people to buy.

78.79.text: Of course, there were a few problems with it,  chief among which was a lack of space inside.

85.82.text: A gynecologist would get in here and go "God, I'm at work!"

89.78.text: It's like climbing into a giant..  somebody elses giant red posing pouch.

97.86.text: I'm going for a gear change...

104.56.text: I'm going to change gear now - this will involve man-touching.

110.46.text: and the list of faults doesn't end with a tiny cock..  pit

113.68.text: Why did they give the passenger the pedals -  and the driver the wheel?

117.24.text: I don't know - they definitely are over to the right-hand side

120.52.text: You're sort of sitting a bit - sideways...

129.04.text: The other thing I really like as well is - you know a Porsche puts the rev counter right in front of you..?

135.52.text: Lancia in this put the oil pressure right in front of you!

138.22.text: And the temperature! What does that tell you?!

149.13.text: ... but then, you look at it... and there's the thing...

153.74.text: because it just sort of is...

157.91.text: this is one of the best cars ever made...

162.52.text: on the grounds of it's achievement, but also that slightly more subjective thing of how gorgeous it looks...

168.02.text: This was..  STOP doing that to my knee!!

171.42.text: That was a stroke!  That was a stroke!
